meanings.definition: In a manner requiring much physical or mental effort
meanings.sent1: She climbed the steep hill laboredly, panting heavily along the way.
meanings.sent2: He laboredly carried the heavy boxes up the stairs to the second floor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel laboredly tried to lift the giant acorn, but it was too heavy for him.
meanings.sent4: The old car laboredly made its way up the winding mountain road.
meanings.sent5: The student laboredly solved the complex math problem, sweating with concentration.

meanings.sent1: The injured dog limped laboredly towards its owner, seeking help.
meanings.sent2: She laboredly pushed through the dense crowd to reach the front of the line.
meanings.sent3: The toddler laboredly tried to tie his shoelaces, ending up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The ship laboredly sailed through the stormy seas, battling against the fierce waves.
meanings.sent5: The detective laboredly pieced together the clues to solve the mysterious case.
